Content: I unboxed it and everything that was supposed to be included was included. I had a bad experience with one that I returned.. I began by making toast. It is not easy to ruin toast. Well, it came out almost perfectly [The bread was refrigerated - my error]. I will adjust the wire rack next time to a higher level and reduce the time from 6 minutes to 5 minutes. So far 5 stars out of 5.. Next, I grilled a frozen, pre-cooked sausage patty. I pre-heated the oven, but reduced the time to 6 minutes. I put the patty on the grill tray and put it on the lowest level, using the "steak" setting for 4 minutes. It came out perfectly. Again, 5 stars out of 5.. NOTE: I did add a sheet of aluminum foil [shiny side down] on the drip tray to keep it as clean as possible. No effect on time, temperature or result. There was no information about using aluminum foil in the instructions, so I felt that it would be OK.. Then I used the "air fry" setting. I put 8 frozen chicken nuggets in the wire basket, set the oven for "wings" [the nuggets are small like wings], set the pre-heat to 5 minutes and set the time to 10 minutes. Pre-heat went off and I put the wire basket on the second level from the bottom and anxiously waited for the 10 minute timer to finish. Not to my amazement, they also came out perfectly. I added some hot sauce for flavor. Once again, 5 stars out of 5.. NOTE: These were not home made. Over the weekend when I have more time, I will make chicken nuggets from scratch.. Pros: Easy to use. Easy to clean. The only 2 knobs [Temperature and Time] are well lit from the back, easy to see and easy to turn. The food comes out perfectly cooked. It is very easy to adjust the Temperature and/or Time. The instructions are clear with black and white drawings.. Con: As hard as I tried, I was not able to teach the oven to walk my dog or fill out my tax returns and I am not able to give it 10 stars.. This is a BIG WINNER. Buy one. You will not be sorry.. Well here is the weekend. I made an egg and heavy cream wash and rolled some chicken in Panko crumbs with some spices. Turned the air fryer on, used the settings for chicken. Perfect.

Name: Chantel
Content: I purchased this to replace my broken toaster oven and I've been waiting a few weeks to write the review, specifically, before I tried out a few of the recipes in the book that comes with the air fryer. Because of that, I had thought that there was something wrong with the appliance because nothing was coming out right. So far, I have attempted to make the Apple Crisps, Mozarella Sticks, Banana Bread, Sweet Potato Fries and the German Pancakes.. All of them came out WRONG.. The German Pancakes were underbaked (liquid in the middle). The Apple Crisps were soggy. Mozarella Sticks were stodgy. Sweet Potato Fries, limp and the Banana Bread was undercooked in the middle. Luckily, I have some experience when it comes to baking, so my second time around, attempting some the same recipes, I made adjustments. My sweet potato fries are delicious and my husband finished my banana nut loaf in two days. Needless to say, do not rely on the recipe book (I am sure a lot of information was hurried/omitted to keep it looking attractive) but take the time to visit other cooking website or rely on your own cooking knowledge. For example, I don't think there is any appliance in the world that can cook a loaf of banana bread in 30 minutes at a low temp.. When cooking other things, such as tator-tots, veggie chicken nuggets, corn dogs, etc. the air fryer works extremely well! You can keep using the same temperature you would usually when cooking things like these, simply take it out of the air fryer a few minutes earlier.. For that, I lowered the stars in the "Easy to Use" category because you, most of the time, have to watch your food until you learn/memorize what settings, cooking temps and cooking times to adjust. Once I become more familiar with the product, I'm sure I will love it. Right now, it is an adventure.

Content: This is the third air-fryer I've purchased. The first was very similar to this one, but it made everything smell like burnt plastic and taste just as bad. I ran the initial cleaning proceedure for a couple of weeks before it finally went away -- and didn't try to cook anything in it before then. I wrote to the manufacturer, but never got an answer. But then, I was finally able to use it. I was able to fit more food in this one than I expected (more than my previous fryer and the toaster oven, too -- which surprised me). It was much easier to clean than expect. Very simple. The basket and tray go right into the dishwasher. I was impressed with that.. It comes with a big transparent sticker with a "Settings Guide", which I found helpful. But, insead of painting it on the unit, or at least sticking the sticker on for you, this company expects you to apply it yourself. I wasn't able to do it correctly. I kept getting air bubbles in it and it started to curl the first time I tried to peel it off and reapply it. It looks terrible an makes an otherwise attractive appliance look cheap and shoddy. I'm going to peel it off permanently as soon as I have memorized the settings.

Name: Amy K.
Content: Original review: I've had my Nuwave Bravo XL for a few days and I wish I could give it a glowing review, but after less than stellar results I can't. I think that over time, I will learn to work around its quirks. My version came with a number of accessories including a silicone mat and a mesh tray/rack but not an air fryer basket (I can use the mesh rack, though it's not as deep).. The first head scratch moment was trying to assemble the racks in it since what I got didn't match the instructions. I'll figure out how best the racks and trays fit and ignore the manual. Note: the manual is easier to follow once you've used the Bravo a few times because you'll be more familiar with the knob and buttons.. Tried to make toast, burnt the first and undercooked the second. I make my own bread, so will have to experiment with what will actually work, homemade bread seems to toast differently than store bought.. Major issue with the warming function. I wanted to proof my pizza dough and chose the warming function. When chosen, it is supposed to default to 140 degrees for 1 hour. You can easily adjust temperature up or down. I readjusted it to 80 degrees. I followed the instructions. You can see the result in the picture (fortunately my husband noticed before we had a real disaster and only lost the container). When I checked the unit it was set to 350. I thought I had messed up, but have since tried this function, manual in hand and find that it ultimately defaults to 350 for 15 minutes. (I learned from customer service that the warm function kicks in after you've performed another function, i.e. bake at 350 for 15 minutes).. So does it cook? Absolutely, but be very watchful until you really figure it out.. Update 2/17/23: Company contacted me directly and provided guidance and acknowledged that the manual is not very clear and will look to adjust it in the future. 5 stars for customer service!

Name: PJvb
Content: This is an interesting toaster over/air fryer combo. To start with, it does take up quite a bit of space. Make sure to check dimensions against your space to ensure it will fit and take into account that the top and sides do get hot so it probably shouldn't be tightly against the bottoms of upper cabinets or other items. It comes with a rack, bake tray, rotisserie contraption, and a crumb catcher for the bottom. Mine came with what seems to be a bit of the silver paint on the handle chipped off but other than that, it looks nice.. The instructions are a bit difficult to understand and I've mostly relied on trial and error. There are several modes, top heat, bottom heat, top & bottom heat, toast, pizza, dough proofing, and a few others. For several of the modes, including toast, you have to set two separate temperature settings which I find a bit odd. The instructions say something about making sure they aren't more than 70 degrees (or something like that) different. I'm not sure why you would pick different temperatures for cooking in such a relatively small space unless it was perhaps to avoid something browning too much on the top or bottom while you were cooking. I've not experimented too much with this, just keeping the temperature the same for both.. There are a few little quirks, for example when using the toast function the timer won't count down. you can set it and it will blink when it's toasting but the number won't change. When it is done, it will beep. The actual beep is pretty quiet though, so if you won't be standing right next to it, I would suggest setting a separate timer. It's possible the timer for the toast function is more a "toasted" amount than a time but I haven't had any issue assuming it was a timer and using as such.. I have had some chemical smell when in use, mostly after it is done cooking and in the cool down period (but that may be more that it takes that long to get to the temperature that makes the smell). It doesn't linger for too long and is only noticeable right next to the oven. Hopefully this fades with time and use.. All in all, I am enjoying having this as an option for cooking. I look forward to experimenting with it more in the future to realize just how much it can do.

Content: I ordered this mainly for the air fryer function. This is not an air fryer! It’s great for toasting and baking and roasting though. You have the option to use the both the top and bottom bake mode or just one or the other. The crumb tray easily comes out for cleaning. I have not used the rotation set to roast, say, a chicken yet. This oven is nice for baking or roasting in the hot summertime because it doesn’t heat up your kitchen. It is very stylish and the stainless steel goes with any kitchen decor. The one thing I do not like about this oven is that when the timer you set for cooking your item is finished, no sound comes on to let you know the timer is finished. So I basically have to set the timer on my kitchen stove or the clock on my phone so it will alert me that the item im cooking is finished. Other than that, I like everything about this oven. The timer issue is a little annoying though.

Content: This isn’t an air fryer it’s a newer version of those old countertop toaster ovens that were popular in the 80’s. That being said you can sure use this for all of the things you’d have used the toaster oven for. Mainly frozen pizzas or chicken nuggets. This has a good lot of power and cooks fairly evenly if you rotate your food in between your cooking time. Overall this is an ok tool for the kitchen but it does take up a lot of counter space and it basically is just a smaller version of our oven. Not sure if it’s worth it.

Content: So when I first saw this, I was very excited because I had an old 9 in 1 air fryer that died on me. So I was really excited to get this one. I have to say, I really love it. I love all the functions and the features. It's very digital. A lot of control options. I Quiet it is. It is a little bit on the bigger side, but it still fits on my counter. I can fit more food in there. One of the biggest features that I absolutely love about this is that I can bake my cakes in here beautifully. I bake a lot of cakes, and sometimes I don't have enough space in my oven. So being able to use this in conjunction with my regular oven has. helped me tremendously. The only. negative that I can say about this is it's not technically an air fryer. It doesn't really have that function. The fan is good and quiet, but not powerful enough to put it in that category of air fryer. Nor does it have even the air fryer option. So I think they should take that off and not advertise it as the air fryer, but overall this is a very good oven. It bakes evenly, heats and bakes well etc. One other small thing I will say is I feel like you have to turn the heat up a little bit higher. For example, when I'm baking a cake at 350 it takes longer than a regular oven so I turn the heat up by 5 degrees and it works better so bump up your temp a bit especially when trying to "air fry" something.
